content: How can I add a list of values to an existing set in Python?

To add a list of values to an existing set in Python, you can use the `update()` method of the set. The `update()` method allows you to add multiple elements to a set. Here's how you can do it:

```python
# Existing set
my_set = {1, 2, 3}

# List of values to be added
my_list = [4, 5, 6]

# Adding the list of values to the set
my_set.update(my_list)

print(my_set)
```

After executing the code above, `my_set` will contain the elements `{1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6}`. The `update()` method processes each item in the list and adds it to the set, ensuring that the set remains a collection of unique elements.
